title.rendered: I’m new / I stopped lifting for a time, how do I start?

content.rendered:
The Adding Physical Activity Page has a recommended training path for those who are new or a bit rusty, and we believe this is the simplest way to get back into the groove. If you’re coming back to it after a long time, be prepared for your lifts to have gone down – probably by a lot. Don’t rush it. If your break was short, you can likely just pick up where you last left off if you shave a little weight off of where you’re at.

It may also be appropriate to use an Intro Week, as described in this EliteFTS article.

jetpack-related-posts.title: How can I get motivated to pursue fitness?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The best thing you can do is to stop thinking that "motivation" is going to be what gets you results. Trying to sustain going to the gym or changing your diet with motivation is like trying to warm your house with a firecracker. It'll give you a short burst of…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Why can't I gain weight?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: If you are not gaining weight, you are not eating enough and are not reaching a calorie surplus. You must eat more. It doesn't matter how much you think you're eating. It doesn't matter what your TDEE calculator says. It doesn't matter what your food logs say. If you're not…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Should I work out if I'm sick?
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Over the internet, it's very hard for others to evaluate how sick you are.
